item.title: test Pricing Plans
item.dc:creator: Chris Duell
item.description: Test to ReleaseNotes has remained the same since it was launched 2 years ago. In that time a lot has been learned about what people need, and how they're using ReleaseNotes.  As a result, pricing has had a refresh to make it simpler, and provide levels that suit each type of team. Two Plan Types For most teams, the standard plan will be enough to get you up and going. It has all...
item.content:encoded:
Pricing for ReleaseNotes has remained the same since it was launched 2 years ago. In that time a lot has been learned about what people need, and how they're using ReleaseNotes. 

As a result, pricing has had a refresh to make it simpler, and provide levels that suit each type of team.

Two Plan Types

For most teams, the standard plan will be enough to get you up and going. It has allowance for subscribers and announcing your releases to them over email, selecting a theme other than the standard theme, unlimited team members, and more.

But if you're looking for more control, like custom domain, custom theme, API access, and private notes, then the Pro plan is what you'll need.

The full details of each plan are below.

Auto-scaling Subscribers

Rather than creating a new plan for each different band of subscriber counts, as well as blocking subscriptions when you reached your plans arbitrary cap, subscribers are now a simple addition to your base plan at the flat rate of just $10 per 1,000 subscribers (regardless of which plan you select), automatically added to your monthly invoice.

If you don't want to pay for subscribers, simply don't add any, easy :)

Introducing the Free Plan

Sometimes all you need is a place to hang your hat, no bells and whistles. Or perhaps you're just getting started with your product and just need to get the ball rolling on sharing your progress. 

That's exactly what the free plan aims to cover. With the free plan, you can display 6 months of your release history (older releases will remain hidden), and use the standard theme at zero cost.

New Features

  • New plan types

  • Auto-scaling subscriber pricing

  • Free plan

Two Plan Types

For most teams, the standard plan will be enough to get you up and going. It has allowance for subscribers and announcing your releases to them over email, selecting a theme other than the standard theme, unlimited team members, and more.

But if you're looking for more control, like custom domain, custom theme, API access, and private notes, then the Pro plan is what you'll need.

The full details of each plan are below.

Auto-scaling Subscribers

Rather than creating a new plan for each different band of subscriber counts, as well as blocking subscriptions when you reached your plans arbitrary cap, subscribers are now a simple addition to your base plan at the flat rate of just $10 per 1,000 subscribers (regardless of which plan you select), automatically added to your monthly invoice.

If you don't want to pay for subscribers, simply don't add any, easy :)

Introducing the Free Plan

Sometimes all you need is a place to hang your hat, no bells and whistles. Or perhaps you're just getting started with your product and just need to get the ball rolling on sharing your progress.

  • Free plan
